value.title: #37 Easily create infographics in Power BI with infographics desginer
value.excerpt: #37 Easily create infographics in Power BI with infographics desginer  Do you want to create infographics in Power BI? In this video I will show you how to do just that!  Information graphics or infographics are graphic visual representations of information, data or knowledge intended to present information

value.title: Building relationships between tables when both have duplicates
value.excerpt: PowerPivot and Power BI Desktop only allow the creation of relationships between tables when one of columns forming the relationship does not have duplicate values. value.title: DAX Fridays! #3: SUM and SUMX
value.excerpt: Dax Fridays! Today we will go through: how to use SUM() and SUMX(), the difference between them and when should we use one vs the other.  The DAX SUM function calculates the sum of all numbers in a column while the DAX SUMX function returns the sum of an expression for each row in a table.  02:28 Create

value.title: Power BI vs Excel: When you should use each tool
value.excerpt: Which tool is best? Power BI or Excel?  Well, it depends on what you are trying to do. Both tools have unique strengths and limitations and in this video I will try to show both.  Hopefully after watching this video, you will have a better understanding of both tools and will know when to use which depending

value.title: Clean, transform, and load data in Power BI
value.excerpt: Learn how to clean, transform, and load data in Power BI.

value.title: Optimize a model for performance in Power BI
value.excerpt: Data Analysis eXpression (DAX) language is a key feature of Power BI. It is used to create calculated columns, calculated tables, and measures. In this module, you will learn how to use DAX to solve typical analytics problems. You will learn about one of the most popular DAX functions, CALCULATE, and how it can override the default behavior of Power BI.

value.title: DAX Fridays! #14: SUMMARIZE
value.excerpt: Learn how to use the function SUMMARIZE in DAX/ Powerpivot.  The function SUMMARIZE can return a summary of sales grouped around the calendar year and the product category name, this result table allows you to do analysis over the reseller sales by year and product category.  Source:https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/gg492171.aspx
